attributes.action: Ban people from smoking inside all local authority/ association owned houses
attributes.background:
Banning smoking in local authority/association owned houses will reduce passive smoking which other people in the property do not want to inhale. 

It will reduce the amount of fire damage that could occur if the cigarette isn't extinguished properly
attributes.additional_details:
It can stop potential nuisance of litter been thrown from windows into neighbours gardens and the street better for the environment and less encouragement to rats 

May reduce smoking rate so people may quit and become healthier

attributes.action: Make feminine hygiene products free.
attributes.background: Women are expected to pay a significant amount of their income each month to pay for essential feminine hygiene products. The process women go through is completely natural and not their choice. The idea that they pay for such necessary products while contraception can be free is ridiculous.
attributes.additional_details: The average woman's income annually is £22,381. Take out their tax and their personal allowance. They spend £2,160 approximately on food annually and approx £492 annually on feminine hygiene products. That's money that could be better spent on themselves or on their families. For low income women and students who struggle to eat, this is atrocious. They are still finding the money to look after their bodies. The government should start to pay for such products.

attributes.action: Start supplementing milk with Vitamin D.
attributes.background: Many countries supplement their milk supply with vitamin d and the UK which rarely gets sunshine does not.
attributes.additional_details: There has been evidence showing that many in the UK suffer from vitamin d deficiencies.

attributes.action: Referendum on whether to scrap the TV license
attributes.background:
A choice to remove the BBC's outdated and unfair, politically biased,  monopoly, by scrapping its license fee.

This decision should be put to the country in a Referendum with the question "Do you want to keep paying for the BBC License? Yes or No"

attributes.action: Stop roll out of "Academies" to SEN schools.
attributes.background: Stop rolling out academy schools to SEN Schools. How can a private company do better? It's all about money. How can a shared head teacher have lead in the school? The situation is wrong. The government want to pass schools on, reduce budgets and then blame someone else for the schools doing bad.

attributes.action: Start charging for non-emergencies in A & E across the U.K
attributes.background:
There are too many people wasting Doctors time & resources in 
A & E Departments across the U.K. I think these non-emergencies should be charged for time wasting when these people could have gone to their GP or pharmacist to get sorted. The monies collected should then be put back into the system.

attributes.action: Make all companies provide an e mail address as a point of contact
attributes.background: Received a letter from Sky and tried to ring this morning  -  automated service had no option to cancel for my reason! - cut off, tried chat, more than half an hour no one came on to chat - at least an hour of my time wasted! I have a life!
attributes.additional_details: This issue does not just apply to Sky it applies to many big companies, people do not have the time to hang on phone lines for lengthy times due to insufficient staff, or to wait to speak to customer service on line.  Often the problem could be put in an e mail and sent, then the customer just waits for a reply instead of getting frustrated and angry waiting on phone lines.

attributes.action: Change when employers can dismiss employees without cause back to one year.
attributes.background: The qualifying period for unfair dismissal increased from one to two years in April of 2012. This made it easy for a company to dismiss someone after less than two years' employment. You could work for a company for nearly two years and be dismissed for no apparent reason.
attributes.additional_details: You have no options once this happens as the company is not obligated to reinstate you, offer another position, and neither are you entitled to compensation outside their discretion which is quite often unsatisfactory. With the current system, good employees are left with no security.

attributes.action: Fund retraining of local authority health officers at every level
attributes.background: Fully fund awareness training of local council health officers at every level to recognise their obligations to enforce prosecutions of slum rogue landlords when issuing improvement notices.Vulnerable tenants and families are placed at greater risk of exploitation by current legislation.
attributes.additional_details:
Local authories work with slum landlords by communicating direct with them instead of engaging with and involving the tenant throughout.
This process needs to be more transparent with accountability at every stage .
Private sector tenants are disenfranchised by the current legislation.
This allows slum landlords to bypass the tenants concerns and issues and communicate directly with local councils and place vulnerable tenants at risk.Council staff EHOs need more training at every level

attributes.action: Write off all the student loans up to the current academic year.
attributes.background:
All student loans are mis-sold. The main reasons are:
Lack of information provided at the time of agreement i.e. interest rates and the term of the loan.
No information or support provided during the term of the loan.
No communication provided after the course ended on how much is owed.
attributes.additional_details:
Student loans have been a huge scam, pulling in students by millions and selling them an idea of a cheap loan. All the loans should be written off, new regulations and guidelines should put into place from next academic year so students know what they are getting themselves into.There is a serious breach of duty of care which the government owes to us all as the loans are provided by the government.
https://www.theguardian.com/money/2016/jun/04/student-loans-really-were-mis-sold

attributes.action: lower to a 5% VAT  rather than 20% vet bills and costs to every pet owner
attributes.background: realising i pay more on VAT pet bills than my yearly gas and electric Bill, it's stupid yes pets are an option so I understand the cost but to most elderly a dog/pet is what they get up for every morning it's not fair for them to be paying this amount or anyone for that matter

attributes.action: Help long term borough council foster carers move home to Care for more children
attributes.background:
I am a foster carer with over 12 years experience, having looked after over 45 children. 
I believe the government could help long serving foster carers to move to a larger home so that more children have access to good levels of care.
attributes.additional_details: The average IFA placement is over 2.5 times the cost of an in house placement for a looked after child. Meaning that if I had enough room for another LAC at home I would save the government over £500000 in the next ten years. Surely some level of investment coupled with a contract for the foster carers would be a very sound investment in the long term. I am sure that every councils IFA bill far exceeds its bill for in house carers. Let's fix this problem.

attributes.action: Introduce a law for raised minimum temperature for employees or send home.
attributes.background: Worked as Receptionist & had poor work temperatures & inadequate heating for building. I feel it's important a law is put in place to outline a realistic,acceptable minimum & maximum work environment temperature for all employees or send employees home if needs are not met. As 16C is too cold.
attributes.additional_details:
According to The workplace (Health, Safety & Welfare) regulations 1992. 

There is "no law outlining the  minimum or maximum work environment temperature. According to Health & Safety executive a "reasonable" work environment should be provided by employers. According to the approved code of practice, a workplace should be atleast 16C and 13C for an environment that requires rigorous physical effort." I feel this is too cold for most in a work environment. This should be assessed and changed.

attributes.action: Allow non-UK citizens to vote in general elections after 5 years of UK residence
attributes.background: We want all non-EU/non-commonwealth citizens living in the UK to have full voting rights (including in general elections) after 5 years of residence. In order to create a truly representative government we must include the opinions of these people who make up approximately 8% of the UK population.
attributes.additional_details: I recently discovered that non-EU citizens are ineligible to vote in UK general elections, and on further research that non-commonwealth citizens have no voting rights at all. It seems wrong that people who have lived and worked in the UK for a considerable period have no say in their futures. There has been a drastic increase in hate crimes towards foreigners in the UK since the Brexit vote, and making them more a part of our society can only help to make them feel more welcome.

attributes.action: Commission new Royal Yacht Britannia using British Shipyards, Materials and Jobs
attributes.background: The Royal Yacht Britannia served as an important symbol of Britain throughout her many years at sea helping to solidify various international relations throughout the world. It rightly was a symbol of national pride and was an important diplomatic tool of considerable weight and importance worldwide
attributes.additional_details:
HMY Britannia served her country from 16 April 1953 and was sadly decommissioned in 11 December 1997.
This was a proud symbol of an international Britain, able to accommodate not only Her Majesty and other Royals but also various foreign dignitaries and leaders which offered an unparalleled diplomatic platform to show the very best of British industry to the world with trade agreements and much more brought to fruition aboard her.
Britain now needs another Royal Yacht Britannia more than ever!

attributes.action: Make it law that pubs and restaurants have to have diet lemonade available
attributes.background: If you want lemonade in a pub or restaurant then there is a good chance you have to have full sugar content lemonade. For those of us who are watching our waist line or have diabetes this is a real problem.
attributes.additional_details: There is so much pressure now for us all to reduce our sugar intake and pubs and restaurants should aid us in doing this. Also for those of us who are the designated driver and do not like coke/pepsi, this really restricts the drinks available to us.

attributes.action: more funding for schools to tackle mental health issues in staff and students.
attributes.background: We want schools to gain more access to mental health facilities that can greatly benefit their staff and students. Many people suffer in silence because of the lack of support that they can get, we want to change this to make sure that nobody suffers alone. This may include onsite counsellors.
attributes.additional_details: Mental health can change the way in which you take in information and how you perform in your daily life. This can affect the way that staff will teach and how the students make progress in their examinations. Mental health issues can often lead to you not doing mandatory things such as eating and getting enough sleep, these are very important factors needed to continue a healthy lifestyle.

attributes.action: Make the Care Certificate a mandatory minimum qualification for all care staff
attributes.background:
The Care Certificate course, an outcome of the Cavendish review back in 2013, has still not been made mandatory training for care workers.

In fact, there is still no mandatory minimum level of training for care workers and no quality assurance for training in the care industry.
attributes.additional_details:
In the childcare industry, a nursery must ensure 50% of their workforce are trained to a minimum of Level 2 NVQ for the protection of the children in their care. Aside from DBS checks, many carers are providing care to elderly people in their homes where they live alone, and are doing so without a minimum level of skill.

As we face the realities of an aging population in the UK, what price do we put on providing the best possible care for our elderly relatives, friends, and relatives?

attributes.action: Make MPs provide an annual report to constituents on the work they've done
attributes.background: We are often told by politicians of their intentions at the time they wish for a vote, but accountability is often lost between elections. I ask that all politicians be required to provide a full, non election based report to all constituents on the progress they make on their pledges and beyond.

attributes.action: More citizen, human and working rights lessons into the educational curriculum
attributes.background: a lot of blood and tears was spilled building the cornerstones of what rights we enjoy today as humans, citizens and workers. Unfortunately a lot of young people miss out on this vital information and children should be educated about what rights they have so they are prepared for the real world

attributes.action: Electrocardiogram (ECG) scans should be made compulsory for all young people.
attributes.background: Test every teenager for deadly undiagnosed heart defects that kills 12 people every week in the UK. 80% of heart defects are found through ECG scans, as there are no symptoms - meaning hundreds of lives would be saved each year. One in 500 people suffer and their hearts could stop at any point.
attributes.additional_details: Renowned cardiologist Professor Sanjay Sharma, medical director for the virgin London Marathon and Professor of Cardiology at St George's University Hospital, agrees saying: 'Each week 12 young people in the UK die suddenly from a heart condition they didn't know they had.' 'The vast majority of those - more than 80% - won't have symptoms, but the same proportion would have been picked up through a three minute ECG.'

attributes.action: There Must be Prison For Attacks on Police, Minimum Prison Sentence Six Months.
attributes.background: As we rely on the Police for Protection so they Must be Protected when Attacked, Courts should never let the Attackers off with just a Slap on the Hand, Respect is needed not only for the Police but All Emergency Services who do a Great and sometimes Difficult Job, Let’s get them some redress.
attributes.additional_details:
Far too many are getting Attacked these days and costing money in Sick pay which could be spent on Services.

Please support this and get them backing in our Courts.

Thanks

attributes.action: Make 'traffic light' food/drink labelling legally compulsory in the UK.
attributes.background:
One often reads, hears or sees in the news these days that obesity levels in the UK
have reached pandemic proportions,
leading to concerns about the risk of heart disease and diabetes, among other serious and life-changing illnesses.
attributes.additional_details: A big contributing factor is the amount of excess fat, saturated fat, salt and sugar consumed by the average UK citizen on a daily basis. There is a clear system available called the "traffic lights", whereby food and drink items can be rated using red (high), amber (medium) and green (low) images to simply and clearly indicate how much fat, saturated fat, salt and sugar are contained in 100 grams or 100 millilitres of an item. As I understand it use of the traffic lights is currently voluntary.

attributes.action: Create an international phone number for UK emergency services.
attributes.background: There have been cases in the media of people attempting suicide over live streaming on social media sites or posing a danger to themselves online. These situations have been streamed internationally but people in foreign countries are not able to report these incidents in the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details: An international UK emergency service number, I believe, is vital and would allow for people abroad to report an incident first hand and potentially speed up the response to incidents of such a nature.

attributes.action: Reduce the amount of time children have to spend at school
attributes.background: We need to reduce the amount of time children spend at school, this is due to the negative effects that can be caused to children if they spend extended periods of time at school like depression. I ask that the UK Government reduce the amount of time a child in the UK has to spend at school.

attributes.action: Include tax exempt income in child maintenance payments.
attributes.background: Child maintenance payments do not include tax-exempt income. For example, a parent who was injured in war can receive thousands of pounds per month in tax-exempt pension. Of this they would only have to pay a few pounds per week to their child.
attributes.additional_details: How is it ok that the government remove financial responsibility for children when it can clearly be afforded?

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for public transport (buses) to be fitted with seatbelts.
attributes.background: In light of the two elderly ladies who were recently injured on a public transport bus.

attributes.action: Retest EVERY driver every 10 years when photo card licence needs to be renewed.
attributes.background:
Currently, driving licences last until the holder reaches 70 years, but the photograph on their licence must be updated every 10 years. 
As an Approved Driving Instructor (ADI) I have to be re-tested every so-often to prove that I am "up to standard". Why not apply the same rule to all drivers?
attributes.additional_details: Driving licence photos must be renewed every 10 years. MANY drivers say "I couldn't pass my test again". We (ADI's) are required to teach "safe driving for life". Rules change. Signs change. Road layouts change. Change the licence requirements. DVSA could call the renewing licence holder for a "check" free of charge. If the licence holder passes their check DVLA will issue a renewed licence. If the holder fails the check their licence would be suspended until they pay for each check and pass.

attributes.action: Put grammar schools in all counties
attributes.background: Lots of high school children are held back in their current schools. If they go to a grammar school they will be encouraged, pushed, and will improve greatly!

attributes.action: More funding for the National Health Service and take it out of crisis
attributes.background: I have seen casualty departments where people are begging for help, I've seen where patients are being kept in corridors and I've seen nurses and doctors struggle to provide the appropriate care required when they are stretched to their limit.

attributes.action: Introduce compensation  for misleading people to buy diesel cars
attributes.background: We were told to buy diesel cars a few years ago and now we are being told to buy electric cars. If you have a diesel car you have to pay to enter into London when the government were the ones who told us to get diesel cars as they are better. I think we should get money from the government for this
attributes.additional_details: I believe we should get compensation for this as we were told to buy diesel cars and now we have to pay extra for someone's mistake

attributes.action: Reverse the planned ban on letting agent fees to tenants
attributes.background: The UK Government is currently putting a bill through Parliament to ban letting agents or landlords from charging any fees to tenants for renting a home. This ban will likely put costs to tenants up so we would like to see it reversed before primary legislation is passed as a cap is more appropriate
attributes.additional_details: A ban on fees to tenants will simply push these costs onto landlords who are a long way from all being able to afford them. This will drive up rents and drive down standards and, crucially, reduce supply as landlords are squeezed on top of recent tax changes. Asking prospective tenants to make a reasonable contribution to the vetting process is in no way unreasonable and a cap is a perfectly workable compromise. The Government’s broken housing policy needs private landlords right now.

attributes.action: Ban (Prospective) Employers asking about salary history from job applicants
attributes.background: Law makers say asking about salary history continues the cycle of pay inequality and makes it harder for people to change careers/jobs. The salary question is a hidden,yet,pervasive form of discrimination. It enables employers to use potential employee's past salary to determine the salary to offer.
attributes.additional_details:
Some states in the U.S (e.g. New York city) has already passed the law (in 2017) prohibiting employers to ask about salary history in interviews or on applications.
By banning the question during the hiring process, employers will be required to offer jobs and compensation to prospective employees based on their own skills, merit and demands of the job, not gender, race or ethnicity.
Banning salary history question is the next step to take in the fight to end the pay gap.

attributes.action: Prevent UK universities classifying British citizens as international students.
attributes.background:
Currently, a British citizen must live in the UK for the 3 years before starting university. This discriminates against citizens who have lived abroad. 

The loose fee-status specifications allow for different institutions to classify the same student as an international and a home student.
attributes.additional_details:
Despite being a British citizen, I am currently paying £20,000 per year to attend Durham University. 

The Department for Education justifies this by claiming British Citizens who have lived abroad have no access to public funds when they return to the UK, but there is no equivalent barrier to benefits, the NHS, or similar means of public funds. 

This is a call to end the discrimination, not a request to access the Students Loan Company. This is a demand to be treated as equal.

attributes.action: Abolish business rates and replace with business rates transaction charge
attributes.background: Internet based companies have an unfair competitive advantage over traditional bricks and mortar retailers who have to pay business rates.  These disproportionate business rates are contributing towards the demise and failure of the local high street.   Help redress the imbalance for all retailers.
attributes.additional_details:
A 0.5% business rates charge levied on the sales value of each transaction would be a fair arrangement and would be linked directly to the success of a retail business. 
Since most sales transactions for online and high street retailers are by credit card, the collection mechanism is already in place.  The credit card holder’s physical location or credit card address is readily available for government’s re-distribution to the local authorities.

attributes.action: Change the law so that in court each side always pays their own legal costs
attributes.background: Going to court is hugely in favour of the party with the biggest financial clout. They can afford to risk legal costs that the smaller party can't. The smaller party has no control over the larger parties cost yet may have to pay them. There is no other business where you can't control your costs.

attributes.action: Make it a requirement for people to pass a politics test before they can vote
attributes.background: Make it a requirement for people to have to pass a political competency test in order to be allowed to vote in General Elections, or in Nationwide Referendums. Brexit is a stark reminder; it only takes a small percentage of the population to be politically uneducated to sway a huge national decision
attributes.additional_details: A exam to test background knowledge of basic political systems, taken a few weeks before an upcoming election. This could then be marked over the following days, and anyone who passed will be sent a verification code or something similar to enable them to vote on Election Day. An in depth analysis of how the population did overall on the exam could then be published, allowing political parties to see what areas of knowledge/ which demographics they could address in future election campaigns.

attributes.action: Ban HGV's from using lane 2 between 06:00 to 22:00 hrs on 2 lane highways
attributes.background:
With the introduction of 4 lane smart motorways traffic congestion is worse than ever. HGV's are now actively using lanes 1,2 & 3 restricting every other vehicle to lane 4.

On 2 lane highways they sit side by side for mile after mile unable to pass and holding up other faster moving vehicles.
attributes.additional_details:
1. Between 06:00 and 22:00 hrs no HGV may use lane 2.
2. If the overtaking HGV is unable to pass a slower vehicle in under 90 seconds and safely pull in back in then the move should not be attempted.
3. HGV's must not use lane 3 on "smart" motorways.
4. HGV's up to 7.5 tonnes may not use lane 4 on smart motorways, anyone found doing so should receive 6 penalty points and a £1000 fine. Use of the overhead cameras to identify culprits could be used.

attributes.action: Build and repair road surfaces using the plastic waste produced in the UK
attributes.background: Households in the UK produce 22 million tonnes of waste per year and only 44% is recycled. Our country keeps exporting our waste (particularly plastic) to other far shores. Since China have introduced a ban against this, the government are searching for new places to export.
attributes.additional_details: The Netherlands have recently introduced the usage of recycled plastics in the re-surfacing and building of road surfaces. Not only does it recycle the waste that we create, but it also reduces CO2 damage caused by the original asphalt. This surface can withstand extreme temperatures from -40 degrees to 80 degrees. Many road surfaces desperately require repair and this is a quick, simple solution that forces our country to take responsibility for our negative environmental impact.

attributes.action: Let the general public have a vote on military action in Syria.
attributes.background: Let the public vote on military action in syria. Let us have a say on how our military should be used, not just government.
attributes.additional_details: With tensions rising in Syria it's important to protect our military from going into another war in the middle east.

attributes.action: Outlaw the use of gas gun type bird scarers.  They dont work and are a nuisance
attributes.background:
Gas gun type bird scarers are used by farmers to scare birds from their crops.
They periodically make a series of loud bangs to scare the birds.
The loud bang also scares passers by, horse and dogs.
The birds return after a few minutes making them ineffective and a nuisance.
attributes.additional_details:
There do not appear to be any statutory restrictions on the the use of gas guns but the NFU has guidelines on their use:- https://www.nfuonline.com/assets/4662

The guidelines are largely ignored, the gas guns are inevitably plonked in a field and forgotten about.
Their proliferation has made the countryside sound like a battlefield.

Given how ineffective they are and the number of them that are thoughtlessly deployed (too many for local authority control). They should be outlawed.

attributes.action: Remove chargeable road tax for UK vehicles over 30 years old
attributes.background:
Currently as it stands the total value of road tax paid on my classic car since new now out-values the value of the car itself today ! and also may be higher than the original RRP of the vehicle in 1986.
I hereby request to open a petition to remove chargeable road tax on vehicles over 30 years old

attributes.action: Halt arms sales to Saudi Arabia.
attributes.background: Saudi Arabia has carried out indiscriminate airstrikes in Yemen which have resulted in thousands of civilian deaths.
attributes.additional_details: These have been allowed by the British government's licensing of £4.6bn of arms sales to the kingdom since the start of the Yemeni Civil War in 2015. Saudi Arabia's blockade of Yemen has also resulted in the worst humanitarian crisis in the world.

attributes.action: Change the law to ensure that NICE guidance outweighs the "Bolam Test"
attributes.background: I have suffered a heart attack which left me disabled. I allege this was due to sub-standard practices. However, solicitors say that my case would not meet the 'Bolam Test', in that, if a similar expert would have 'done the same thing' then a claim will fail even if NICE guidance has been ignored.
attributes.additional_details:
Nice Guidance states that “If you currently have chest pain ... you may need to go to hospital as an emergency ... if you do not currently have chest pain and your ECG was normal … you should have an assessment in hospital on the same day" 
(Solicitor's response - below) 
".. NICE guidelines are recommendations ... advice they provide should not be compared to .. many years of professional experience".

attributes.action: Repair pot holed roads by introduction of vignette system for foreign drivers
attributes.background: Many countries in Europe make road users pay to use motorways and major roads, either by way of tolls or a vignette system. I propose introducing a Vignette system in the UK for foreign drivers which would raise revenue to be shared amongst the counties and used solely for repairing road surfaces.
attributes.additional_details: Pot holes in UK roads are increasing due to councils lack of funds for repairs. This causes serious safety issues for drivers and cyclists and can cause major damage to vehicles.

attributes.action: Make garden bonfires and any external fires illegal without a permit.
attributes.background: Bonfire smoke is a health risk for people with asthma & breathing problems. Wind will distribute smoke over a wide area, especially in steep sided valleys. It is a basic human right to have access to clean, breathable air. Environmentally safe waste disposal is universally available in the UK.

attributes.action: Raise the Penalty for Uninsured Motorists
attributes.background: Currently the penalty for driving a motor vehicle with no insurance is £300 and 6 points on your license. With this being the case, millions of motorists take the gamble!
attributes.additional_details:
If you are involved in a road traffic accident that was not a fault of your own, usually the third party’s insurance would cover the damage to your vehicle and your insurance excess. If however, the third party is an uninsured driver, this then falls on you to recover your costs. 

Millions of motorists are uninsured because the penalty for doing so is not severe enough. A £300 fine is cheaper than most annual insurance quotes!

The fine should be more severe to prevent this from happening.

attributes.action: Give anyone who has a long-term health condition medication on the NHS
attributes.background:
Some people end up needing hospital treatment because they cannot afford their medication. 

Health officials say they have made sure people with chronic illnesses have access to affordable prescription but the current system is arbitrary and unfair.
attributes.additional_details: People with Diabetes have their medication and equipments on the NHS but what about people who have the leading cause of death being Heart Disease in the UK/World-wide? Conditions such as Heart Disease, Crohns or Parkinson's etc should be available on the NHS, doing this could save thousands of lives.

attributes.action: Increase armed forces budget
attributes.background: We believe that the armed forces are receiving too little in budget and pay. and we believe that they should get more money due to the fact that everyday their life is put on the line.

attributes.action: Ban the use and sale of all non-recyclable plastics in the UK by 2025
attributes.background:
Plastic is a direct threat to the long term survival of all species, with the amount of plastic pollution in the oceans and land expanding at a catastrophic rate.
HM Government's strategy on plastic waste is inadequate in its current form and must be reviewed to ban all harmful plastics by 2025.
